alert.note: Alert for Greene (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 17 at 4:03PM EST until December 18 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of eastern North Carolina, including the following areas, Beaufort, Coastal Onslow, Duplin, Greene, Inland Onslow, Jones, Lenoir, Martin, Northern Craven, Pamlico, Pitt, Southern Craven, Washington and West Carteret. * WHEN...Until 4 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Around an inch of rainfall has fallen across much of the area so far today, with an additional 2 to 4 inches of rainfall expected across the watch area, with locally higher amounts. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
